channel.title: Regex Expression
channel.description:
I have the following patterns: iconst_m1 istore aload_0 iconst_0 putfield getstatic getfield arraylength newarray iconst_ 651 - revision
athrow iconst_1 putfield getstatic getstatic if_acmpne getstatic iconst_2 652 - revision
aload_0 iconst_0 putfield iconst_m1 istore getstatic 653 - revision
I'm trying to grab the putfield in these fields, I tried the following: ((aload_0)? (iconst_0|iconst_1) putfield (getstatic|iconst_m1)?)
And it can match all three of the patterns above... but I know i will get more than one field as a return.
So how can I create a RegXP for the following so I dont get more than one output.

item.title: Regex Expression
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

use regex.group(n) where n is the bracket you want to get, using your expression

(aload_0)? (iconst_0|iconst_1) (putfield) (getstatic|iconst_m1)?

if you wanted the putfield you would use regex.group(3)

Read full topic

item.title: Regex Expression
item.dc:creator: @Game_Master1 Game Master
item.description:
@Game_Master1 wrote:

I have the following patterns:
iconst_m1 istore aload_0 iconst_0 putfield getstatic getfield arraylength newarray iconst_ 651 - revision

athrow iconst_1 putfield getstatic getstatic if_acmpne getstatic iconst_2 652 - revision

aload_0 iconst_0 putfield iconst_m1 istore getstatic 653 - revision

I’m trying to grab the putfield in these fields, I tried the following:
((aload_0)? (iconst_0|iconst_1) putfield (getstatic|iconst_m1)?)

And it can match all three of the patterns above… but I know i will get more than one field as a return.

So how can I create a RegXP for the following so I dont get more than one output.
